value.title: Improve security with Azure Sentinel, a cloud-native SIEM and SOAR solution | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Sarah Young joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Sentinel, which is a scalable, cloud-native, security information event management (SIEM) and security orchestration automated response (SOAR) solution. Azure Sentinel delivers intelligent security analytics and threat intelligence across the enterprise,
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/oiWInLYvnUk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Introducing the next generation of Azure Stack HCI | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Scott Hanselman sits down with Cosmos Darwin to learn about Azure Stack HCI, which is a new host operating system for hyperconverged infrastructure. Delivered as an Azure service, Azure Stack HCI provides the latest and up to date security, performance, and feature updates. To illustrate the flexibility

value.title: Learn all about Distributed Application Runtime (Dapr), Part 1 | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Aman Bhardwaj and Yaron Schneider join Scott Hanselman to talk about the core concepts of Distributed Application Runtime (Dapr). Dapr is a portable, event-driven runtime that makes it easy for developers to build resilient, microservice stateless and stateful applications that run on the cloud and edge

value.title: Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure, Part 2 | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: The Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure guides customers through their cloud journey, to use and adopt cloud services with confidence and in control. In this episode, Scott Bockheim shows Lara Rubbelke the tools, templates, assessments, and resources to implement the guidance from this framework

value.title: Operational best practices for web apps on Azure App Service | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Azure App Service hosts millions of apps, serves trillions of requests per day, and has an SLA of 99.95%. But what should you do when your app has issues in production? Byron Tardif joins Scott Hanselman to discuss some operational best practices for running your web apps on Azure App Service.  0:00

value.title: What are work or school, and Microsoft personal accounts? | One Dev Question: Jean-Marc Prieur
value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Jean-Marc Prieur, a Principal Program Manager Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains the difference between work and school accounts, and personal Microsoft accounts.   Get more information at: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/

value.title: Automate tasks in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Scripting repetitive tasks in Azure SQL for regular maintenance jobs and multi-instance administration. Automation of error and resource alerts. Configuration of notifications for failures.

topItems.title: Configure automatic deployment for Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Utilize Azure Resource Manager templates for deploying Azure SQL resources.

topItems.title: Schedule tasks using SQL Server Agent
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for scheduled tasks and automatic alerts for SQL Server and Managed Instance. Configure extended event sessions for tracing activities.

topItems.title: Manage Azure PaaS resources using automated methods
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for Azure SQL Database and Open Source databases. Configure elastic jobs and Azure Policy.

value.title: Evaluate text with Azure Cognitive Language Services
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Cognitive Language Services to analyze text, determine intent, detect adult themes, and process natural language input

topItems.title: Classify and moderate text with Azure Content Moderator
topItems.excerpt: In this module, we'll introduce you to Azure Content Moderator and show how to use it for text moderation

topItems.title: Add conversational intelligence to your apps by using Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS)
topItems.excerpt: In this module, we'll introduce you to Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) and show how to build and publish a LUIS model

topItems.title: Discover sentiment in text with the Text Analytics API
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the Text Analytics API and Azure Functions to discover what your customers are really saying in their feedback about your products or brands.

value.title: Implement Access Management for Apps
value.excerpt: Implement Access Management for Apps

topItems.title: Plan and design the integration of enterprise apps for SSO
topItems.excerpt: Plan and design the integration of enterprise apps for SSO

value.title: Large-Scale Data Processing with Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2
value.excerpt: With this learning path, you'll use Azure Data Lake Storage to process your Big Data efficiently and easily while also being protected by Azure’s host of security features.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Data Lake storage
topItems.excerpt: Discover how Data Lake Storage provides a repository where you can upload and store unstructured data bringing new efficiencies to processing big data analytics.

topItems.title: Upload data to Azure Data Lake Storage
topItems.excerpt: Learn about creating an Azure Data Lake Storage account and uploading data to Data Lake Storage Gen 2 through the Azure Storage Explorer.

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data with access keys, secure networks, and Advanced Threat Protection monitoring.

value.title: Manage cloud resources
value.excerpt: The second learning path in a course on Cloud Administration from Carnegie Mellon University. Learn more about how the cloud works by exploring its underlying technology of virtualization, how to take advantage of the cloud for scale, and how to automate cloud resource management.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Discover what cloud elasticity means and different ways to scale your cloud resources.

topItems.title: Automate cloud resource management
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about how to automate cloud resource management with scripts and infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.

value.title: Optimize query performance in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Analyze individual query performance and determine where improvements can be made. Explore performance-related Dynamic Management Objects. Investigate how indexes and database design affect queries.

topItems.title: Describe SQL Server query plans
topItems.excerpt: Read and understand various forms of execution plans. Compare estimated vs actual plans. Learn how and why plans are generated.

topItems.title: Evaluate performance improvements
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

topItems.title: Explore performance-based design
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

value.title: Plan and implement data platform resources
value.excerpt: Deploy data platform resources in Azure for SQL Server and Open Source databases. Explore options for upgrade and migration.  Calculate resource requirements and create templates.

topItems.title: Deploy SQL Server in a virtual machine
topItems.excerpt: Configure virtual machine sizing, storage, and networking options to ensure adequate performance for your database workloads. Choose and configure appropriate high availability options. Investigate options for migrating existing workloads.

topItems.title: Deploy Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Provision and deploy Azure SQL Database and SQL Server Managed Instances. Select the appropriate options when performing a migration to the SQL PaaS platform.

topItems.title: Deploy MariaDB, MySQL, and PostgreSQL on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Compare Open Source Azure Database offerings with Azure SQL Server offerings. Configure an Open Source database and configure high availability and security options.

value.title: Insert and query data in your Azure Cosmos DB database
value.excerpt: Discover the Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer tool that enables you to add or modify data. Create stored procedures in JavaScript.

value.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in financial services
value.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, use cases, and special factors of an AI strategy in financial services that creates business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

value.title: Define an AI strategy to create value in government
value.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, special factors, and use cases of an AI strategy in Government that creates value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

value.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in healthcare
value.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, special factors, and use cases of an AI strategy in healthcare that creates business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

value.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in manufacturing
value.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, special factors, and use cases of an AI strategy in manufacturing that creates business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

value.title: Deploy a containerized application on Azure Kubernetes Service
value.excerpt: Explore how to create and deploy a containerized application by using Azure Kubernetes Service declarative manifest files.

value.title: Configure an Azure Kubernetes Service deployment pipeline using GitHub Actions
value.excerpt: Explore how to create an automated deployment pipeline by using GitHub Actions along with Azure Kubernetes Service.

value.title: Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks
value.excerpt: Create an Azure Notebook and use three popular Python libraries to analyze climate data collected by NASA, then share it.

images.title: Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks

value.title: Analyze DevOps Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration
value.excerpt: Explore the first two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration.

value.title: Analyze and optimize data warehouse storage in Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Analyze and optimize data warehouse storage in Azure Synapse Analytics

value.title: Application and package management using Helm
value.excerpt: Helm is an application package manager for Kubernetes that you use to standardize and simplify the deployment of cloud-native applications on Kubernetes. Here you'll see how to install third-party packages called Helm charts and how to create and install Helm charts for the workloads your teams develop.

value.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources
value.excerpt: Securely authenticate apps to Azure to manage and access Azure services. Service principals and managed identities give your app an Azure AD identity.

value.title: Automate machine learning model selection with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Learn how to use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning to find the best model for your data.

value.title: Automatically provision IoT devices securely and at scale with the Device Provisioning Service
value.excerpt: The focus of this module is on creating a Device Provisioning Service (DPS) to securely handle multiple remote devices. First, you create an IoT Hub, and add the DPS service. Next, an X.509 root certificate, and multiple leaf certificates, are created to handle security. Code for a simulated device is provided. You then link all the pieces together, and verify that your DPS resource works. After completing the module, you should have a good understanding of how to provision Azure IoT devices at scale.
